data.event: The Phoenix area was settled in about 1850 by brothers Hiram and Samuel Colver.
Samuel Colver laid out the town in 1854.
Early residents included Milton Lindley, who operated a sawmill that provided timbers in 1855 for a blockhouse as well as a flouring mill owned by Sylvester M. Wait.

event.title: assigned the official name, Phoenix, to the community and, in 1857

data.event: Wait, who was an agent for the Phoenix Insurance Company of Hartford, Connecticut, assigned the official name, Phoenix, to the community and, in 1857, to its post office.
